isFits: Pixels below this brightness quantile will be be assumed 0.
The central region of the brightness spectrum where the asinh transform will be linear; it will be logarithmic far from this region.
The number of times the asinh transform will be applied

We use SExtractor to create starmasks that are used during ellipse fitting of the galactic disk; SExtractor options may need to be changed for images sufficiently different from SDSS images. You may re-use previously computed starmasks by unchecking 'Compute', or ignore previously computed starmasks using 'Ignore...'

You may re-use previously computed starmasks by unchecking 'Compute', or ignore previously computed starmasks using 'Ignore...'

easy: Median filter radius [pixels], to reduce image noise; use 0 to turn off.
Each galaxy gets its own output directory.

Skip a galaxy if it's supposed to have a starmask but the starmask can't be found; normally if we can't find a starmask we proceed without it, which can make it difficult to isolate the galactic disk if there is, in fact, a bright star nearby.

If the distance between the estimated galaxy center and the image center (in pixels) exceeds this number, the use of star masking is escalated, on the assumption that there is a bright star that is distracting us from finding the center of the galactic disk.  Note the galaxy should be at least this well centered in the input image.
advanced: Deprojects a tilted galaxy to make it appear face-on; turn off only if the galaxy is already close to face-on.
By default a cluster that contains the center cannot be an arm and so is deleted. Uncheck to turn this effect off.
There's probably no reason to turn this off unless you see problems with arms longer than one rotation; if so, please notify the authors.
Tolerance for allowed error increase for the combined cluster when deciding whether to merge two clusters. Larger values are more lenient about allowing merges, but risk over-merging.
Clusters are not considered merger candidates until they are at least this big (in pixels).
Minimum cluster area (in pixels) for inclusion in output.
Minimum orientation similarity [in radians?] needed in order to continue clustering; lower values give more cluster growth and merging.
Objects (arms or the space between them) smaller than this in the standardized image are blurred to insignificance; objects (arms or the space between them) this size or bigger will be detected.
This parameter effects the amount of contrast enhancement caused by the unsharp mask.  Larger values provide higher contrast.
expert: For images of size NxN, three orientation fields are generated at resolutions of full, half, and one-quarter N (default N=256). For resizeDims significantly larger, you may increase numOrienationFieldLevels, as long as the standardized image size is divisible by 2^numOrientationFieldLevels.

Find the galactic disk and resize it to fit inside a square image of size resizeDims (default 256x256). Note that SpArcFiRe has been tuned for square 256x256 images. Use caution turning this off or changing resizeDims since image size impacts many other options,  If you change this option, be prepared to change many other options to get sensible results.
